s.text: Now I have to admit that to a great extent, it rings true."
An industry spokesman suggested that negotiators aim for a reduction in accidental deaths and injuries and a way to prevent guns from reaching criminals.
Gun industry executives met on Monday in Washington with municipal officials, who said they will withdraw their lawsuits if an agreement is reached.

The candidate himself broke party solidarity with a properly alliterative soundbite ("I don't think they ought to balance their budget on the backs of the poor."), which an aide told the NYT was "too good" to be spontaneous.
(The LAT supplies the detail that 39 families who live within 400 yards of the plant still hadn't been allowed home yet).
